metadata.title: CVE-2019-9956 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.8-35 Q16, there is a stack-based buffer overflow in thefunction PopHexPixel of coders/ps.c, which allows an attacker to cause adenial of service or code execution via a crafted image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11').
